meanings.definition: The act of placing something in the wrong position.
meanings.sent1: The mislocations of the books on the shelf made it hard to find the one I needed.
meanings.sent2: She realized the mislocations of the keys when she found them in the fridge.
meanings.sent3: The mislocations of the puzzle pieces led to a funny picture when completed.
meanings.sent4: His mislocations of trust caused him to lose many friends.
meanings.sent5: The mislocations of the stars in the sky created a beautiful pattern.

meanings.definition: A mistake in the placement of something.
meanings.sent1: The mislocations of the furniture in the room made it feel cramped.
meanings.sent2: The mislocations of the ingredients in the recipe resulted in a strange taste.
meanings.sent3: His mislocations of the paint colors turned the room into a rainbow.
meanings.sent4: The mislocations of the road signs confused the drivers.
meanings.sent5: The mislocations of the planets in the solar system puzzled the astronomers.
